text: Q38. | Again assuming that Alice doesn’t receive any additional ACKs, how many more bytes picm—————— e Solution: Alice’s TCP stack maintains a buffer of 512 bytes. Buffer currently has 200 bytes (900 not ACKed — 700 ACKed), as Alice can’t delete bytes between 700 and 900 because it hasn’t been ACKed. So application can write 512 — 200 = 312 bytes more. Answeris 312
